data.title: Abigail Altamirano et al v. The Geo Group, Inc. (5:23
data.meta_description: Abigail Altamirano et al v. The Geo Group, Inc. (5:23-cv-00892), California Central District Court, Filed: 05/17/2023 - PacerMonitor Mobile Federal and Bankruptcy Court PACER Dockets
data.text:
Wednesday, June 28, 2023 17 17 misc Letter of Transmittal - Remand to Superior Court (G-17) - optional html form Wed 06/28 1:32 PM

TRANSMITTAL of documents to San Bernardino County Superior Court. A certified copy of the order of remand and a copy of the docket sheet from this court was sent to San Bernardino County Superior Court, No. CIVSB2227310. (lc)

Related: [-]

16 16 order Remand Case to State Court Wed 06/28 1:29 PM

MINUTES (IN CHAMBERS) by Judge Otis D. Wright, II: RE Plaintiffs' Motion to Remand12 . Having carefully considered the papers filed in connection with the motion, the Court deems the matter appropriate for decision without oral argument. Accordingly, the Court VACATES the , hearing. The Court GRANTS Plaintiffs motion to remand. This case is REMANDED to the Superior Court of California, County of San Bernardino, Case No. CIVSB2227310, 247 W. Third St., San Bernardino CA 92415. All dates and deadlines are VACATED. The Clerk of the Court shall close this case. MD JS-6. Case Terminated. (lc)

10 10 order Minutes of In Chambers Order/Directive - no proceeding held Wed 05/24 2:29 PM

MINUTE ORDER IN CHAMBERS by Judge Otis D Wright, II: This action has been assigned to the calendar of Judge Otis D. Wright II. EFFECTIVE IMMEDIATELY- No mandatory chambers copies required, EXCEPT FOR EXCEPT FOR motions for summary judgment and any other evidence-heavy motions. The Court's Electronic Document Submission System (EDSS) allows people without lawyers who have pending cases in the US District Court for the Central District of California to submit documents electronically to the Clerk's Office The parties may consent to proceed before a Magistrate Judge appearing on the voluntary consent list. PLEASE refer to Local Rule 79-5 for the submission of CIVIL ONLY SEALED DOCUMENTS. CRIMINAL SEALED DOCUMENTS will remain the same. Please refer to Court's Website and Judge's procedures for information as applicable. (lc)

NOTICE OF ASSIGNMENT of Eastern Division Removal Case and Notice re Consent to proceed before a U.S. Magistrate Judge. This case was initially assigned to District Judge Jesus G. Bernal and referred to Magistrate Judge Kenly Kiya Kato for discovery. Pursuant to General Order 23-05, this case has been randomly reassigned to District Judge Otis D. Wright, II. The case number on all documents filed with the Court in this case should read as follows: 5:23-cv-00892 ODW (KKx). (jtil)
